meanings.sent1: After the trip, I need to repack my suitcase with clean clothes.
meanings.sent2: I always have to repack my lunch because I forget something every time.
meanings.sent3: I tried to repack the box, but it kept popping open like a jack-in-the-box.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumbled mess that she needed to repack neatly.
meanings.sent5: The task of repacking the fragile items required patience and precision.

meanings.sent1: The company had to repack the damaged goods before shipping them out.
meanings.sent2: I had to repack the gift because the wrapping paper tore.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to repack the broken toy, but it just wouldn't fit back together.
meanings.sent4: The memories flooded back as she began to repack the old photo albums.
meanings.sent5: The store had to repack the returned items to put them back on the shelves.

meanings.definition: To put into a new package
meanings.sent1: The online order arrived damaged, so they had to repack it for return.
meanings.sent2: I had to repack the cookies in a new box because the old one got wet.
meanings.sent3: She decided to repack the gift in a fancier wrapping paper for a better presentation.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to repack the fragile sculpture for transport to the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The team had to repack the equipment in a sturdier container for the long journey.
